message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with learning representations for pose estimation of articulated objects, which is a problem commonly studied in computer vision (cs.CV). The method proposed involves training a model to predict the appearance of an object from a different viewpoint, given its pose and shape parameters. This involves learning a latent representation that captures detailed pose information, which is a common goal in machine learning (cs.LG). The problem of pose estimation is also relevant to robotics (cs.RO), as it is important for robots to be able to perceive and manipulate objects in their environment. The method proposed involves using unsupervised learning to learn representations, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper involves studying the performance of the proposed method in experiments, which is a common topic in graphics (cs.GR).
